intro: Melilotus sulcatus f. diffusus, commonly known as the hairy melilot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers appear in clusters, and it produces hairy pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
